description.narrative: Girls, boys, adolescents and women of reproductive age receive services for the prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition,which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Early Childhood Development, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable use of high-impact maternal, newborn, child health and nutrition specific and sensitive interventions.

sector.narrative: National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting (excludes intervention-specific strategies)

2018 EO: Evaluation of the UNICEF Level 3 response to the cholera epidemic in Yemen: A crisis within a crisis

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, boys, adolescents and women of reproductive age receive services for the prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition

description.narrative: UNICEF's focus on Prevention of Stunting through IYCF was enhanced through the use of f community health volunteers in 243 districts of Yemen. Smart surveys were conducted in 12 Governorates this year and Micronutrient program reached 76% of the targeted under 5 at the time of reporting. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of children (girls and boys) 6-59 months receiving micronutrient supplementation
Number of pregnant women who receive iron and folic acid supplementation
Number of children 6-59 months receiving Vitamin A supplementation during the year
